You have selected documents which include results posted in the last 24 hours. These results may not have been reviewed by your care team yet, and may require further discussion between members of your care team for clarification before finalization. Those final results will be discussed with you by your care team during your upcoming scheduled appointment. If you do not have an appointment scheduled, or wish to discuss these results earlier, please contact your Care Manager for assistance.

You can password protect the downloaded file by entering a password below. If you don\'t wish to password protect he file leave the password field blank.

Click the download button to begin downloading the file.

Warning: Do not download this file if you are using public device.


Your health data will download as a ZIP file containing a human readable HTML file, as will as a machine readable XML file or importing into other systems.

The encryption method used to password-protect the file(s) uses a more secure method that operating systems like Microsoft Windows may not support natively. Many zip utility programs do support this method - an example of that one that is available to download and install for free is called 7-Zip. Your will need to have the more advanced version of this technology to open your password-protected file(s).
Your health data will be securely sent to the entered provider for importing into their system.\n\nYou must use the email address supplied by your provider.
Please provide a valid email address for securely transmitting this clinical summary into your provider\'s system.
Your clinical summary has been securely transmitted to the email address you provided.

You may password protect the attachment file by entering a password below.


Warning: You will have to provide the password to your email recipient separately for it to be opened.


Your health data will be attached as a ZIP file containing a human readable HTML file, as well as a machine readable XML file for importing into other systems.

Please select all the items below that apply:

1. I authorize Cancer Treatment Centers of America® (CTCA) facilities to:
Release information to the following individual or facility
Obtain information from the following individual or facility
2. I request and authorize Provider to release the health information specified below, from the following treatment dates to Recipients.

3. I understand that my health information may include sensitive categories of information listed below. I request and authorize Provider to release all of the information described below if such information exists unless I specify otherwise.
Uncheck selections below or enter your restrictions

Error encountered downloading form. If this problem persists, please contact Technical Support.
This authorization is valid for release of information for the dates listed on the request.
I understand the above medical center may not condition treatment, payment, enrollment or eligibility for benefits on whether I sign this authorization.
I understand that the use or disclosure of my health information is voluntary except in accordance with federal or state law and any mandatory reporting requirements.
I understand that once my health information is disclosed it may be re-disclosed by the recipient and the information may not be protected by federal or state privacy laws or regulations.
A photocopy or facsimile of this authorization will be treated in the same manner as the original

I understand the information in my health record may contain information concerning Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) testing and disease, psychiatric or behavioral health information or information concerning history of substance abuse and treatment.

I understand that this authorization will expire one year from the date signed on this form. Authorization may be revoked at any time by submitting a request in writing to the HIM department; the revocation will not apply to any information already released.
I understand that I may request a copy of this authorization.
Relation to Patient, if signed by anyone other than the patient

The Release of Information (ROI) Authorization Form has been sent to the Health Information Management (HIM) Team at the selected location for review.\n\nA notification email with this request has also been sent to the email address associated with this Patient account. The email has been encrypted for security purposes and will require authentication to view it.
There was an error while transmitting this Release of Information (ROI) authorization. Please contact your Health Information Management (HIM) Team directly.
If you require a Release of your Medical Information, there are now two ways to speed up the process:
You can download and complete the following document prior to your upcoming visit and deliver it to the ROI office at your treatment facility.
You can also complete the following form online and submit it directly.
For further questions regarding the document or form, please contact the Health Information Management (ROI) team at your treatment facility.
The fax number entered is invalid. Please correct fax number to continue.

During the Public Health Emergency (PHE), many insurance payers were providing coverage for telemedicine visits. However, this was only a temporary arrangement. It is possible that if your medical insurance doesn’t pay, you may be financially liable for the non-covered service. If you have received a request from our insurance verification team, please complete the following Advanced Notice of Non-Coverage form at least 48 hours BEFORE your scheduled telehealth visit, otherwise this telehealth visit will have to be canceled.\n\nYou can complete the following form online and submit it directly.
You can download your most recently submitted ANNC form here.

In some cases, your insurance benefits for telehealth services may be changing. Please check with your insurance to determine if you have telehealth benefits for CTCA telehealth services prior to booking your telehealth appointment. \n\nMedical insurance plans do not pay for everything, even some care that you or your health care provider have good reason to think you need. We expect your medical insurance may not pay for the Telehealth below. If your medical insurance doesn\'t pay, you may be financially liable for the one-covered service.
Does not have telehealth benefits for services provided by CTCA

- Read this notice, so you can make an informed decision about your care. \n- Ask us any questions that you may have after you finish reading. \n- Choose an option below about whether to receive the Telehealth listed above.
If you choose Option 1 or 2, we may help you to use any other insurance that you might have, but your medical insurance plan cannot require us to do this.

string.name: annc_form_choose_options_text
string.b: Choose an option. We cannot choose one for you.

resources.string: Option 1. I want the Telehealth services listed above. You may ask to be paid now, but I also want my medical insurance billed for an official decision on payment, which is sent to me on an Explanation of Benefits (EOB). I understand that if my medical insurance doesn’t pay, I am responsible for payment, but I can appeal to my medical insurance by contacting my plan to inquire how. If my medical insurance does pay, you will refund any payments I made to you, less co-pays or deductibles.
Option 2. I don’t want the Telehealth services listed above. I understand with this choice I am not responsible for payment, and I cannot appeal to see if my medical insurance would pay.
Based on the information we currently have, we are providing this notice. It is not an official decision until the claim is submitted to your medical insurance plan.
Signing below means that you have received and understand this notice. A copy of this notice can be made available at any time.
Your Advanced Notification of Non-Coverage form was submitted.
Substance abuse or diagnosis (i.e., drug or alcohol)

This EHR Module is 2014 Edition compliant and has been certified by an ONC-ACB in accordance with the applicable certification criteria adopted by the Secretary of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. This certification does not represent an endorsement by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services or guarantee the receipt of incentive payments.\n\nCompliance Details — Vendor: Cancer Treatment Centers of America, Date Certified: 09/30/2014, Product Version: myCTCA.com (SM) 2.0, Criteria Certified: Modular EHR (Inpatient), Certification ID Number: 09302014‐2723‐8, Clinical Quality Measures Certified: None, Additional Software Used: None, Certification Criteria: 170.314 (e)(1); (g)(1,4).
Please enter both your CTCA ID and password.
myCTCA is not responding. Please try again later.
You must have an internet connection to use myCTCA. If this problem persists, please contact technical support.
If problem persists, please call CTCA Technical Support at %1$s for assistance.

You can choose to sign in to myCTCA™ simply by using your fingerprint. Be sure that only your fingerprint is stored on this device. Once fingerprint authentication is enabled, anyone with a stored fingerprint on this device could have access to your data.

You can enable or disable this feature at anytime here in the myCTCA™ Settings in the More section.

To learn more about fingerprint authentication and security, please visit Google's web site.

Understand fingerprint security
An unexpected error has occurred. If this problem persists, please contact technical support.

You can rejoin your meeting once you have reconnected to internet.

string.b: Your Telehealth meeting is in progress. Are you sure you want to leave?

string.name: timeout_telehealth_dialog_message
string.b: We apologize your Physician is not able to join today.

resources.string: \"myCTCA\" would like access to your Microphone, Camera, and Bluetooth
\"myCTCA\" would like access to your Microphone and Camera

In order to participate in your telehealth appointment, please go to Settings and enable the Microphone, Camera, and Nearby Devices permissions for \"myCTCA\". Meeting data will not be stored after the telehealth appointment has ended.

In order to participate in your telehealth appointment, please go to Settings and enable the Microphone and Camera permissions for \"myCTCA\". Meeting data will not be stored after the telehealth appointment has ended.
In order to participate in your telehealth appointment. Meeting data will not be stored after the telehealth appointment has ended.
\"myCTCA\" would like access to your Phone
In order to make a phone call to a CTCA facility. Call data will not be stored after the call has ended.
\"myCTCA\" would like access to your Phone
In order to make a phone call to contact CTCA, please go to Settings and enable the Phone permission for \"myCTCA\". Call data will not be stored after the call has ended.
\"myCTCA\" Would like to access your Photos and Media
In order to save a document on your device, please go to Settings and enable the Storage permission for \"myCTCA\".
\"myCTCA\" Would like to access your Photos and Media
to save a document on your device.
For concerns regarding your care, access to medical records and any general questions you might have.
For questions related to creating a portal account, accessing the portal, and password resets.
Connect with a care manager (RN) for questions about your treatment, symptoms or other related concerns you may have.
For changes in your appointments, request for new appointments.
For help with booking flights, car service, hotel stays, rates.
To access patient medical records and help with forms.
For assistance with insurance concerns and financial barriers.
For questions and concerns about services rendered, insurance and billing statements.
Connect with a pharmacist for prescription refills, requesting supplements or other related questions.
